message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.AI, cs.SI 

The paper discusses the regulation of IoT devices to mitigate negative externalities, specifically DDoS attacks. This falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also considers the use of mandatory security requirements and the impact on production costs, which relates to information theory (cs.IT). The use of IoT devices and the need for regulation also falls under the category of networking and internet architecture (cs.NI). The paper also discusses the use of AI and machine learning to improve security, which falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper discusses the efficiency of regulatory policies, which falls under the category of social and information networks (cs.SI).
